concise_definition: v. 滑动, 滑倒,  slipping (现在分词/动名词形式)

definitions.explanation_en: To move unintentionally or suddenly along a surface, especially due to lack of traction or a smooth, wet, or icy surface.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因缺乏摩擦力或表面光滑、湿滑、结冰而意外或突然地在表面上滑动。
definitions.example_en: She was slipping on the icy sidewalk and barely caught herself.
definitions.example_cn: 她在结冰的人行道上滑倒了，勉强才稳住身体。

definitions.explanation_en: To gradually decline or deteriorate in quality, performance, or standards, often unnoticed or unintentionally.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指质量、表现或标准逐渐下降或恶化，通常是不知不觉或非故意的。
definitions.example_en: His academic performance has been slipping since he started working part-time.
definitions.example_cn: 自从他开始兼职工作以来，学业表现一直在下滑。

definitions.explanation_en: To let something escape or be lost unintentionally, such as a word, a secret, or an opportunity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指无意中让某物溜走、丢失或泄露，如词语、秘密或机会。
definitions.example_en: He slipped the truth out during the heated argument.
definitions.example_cn: 在激烈的争论中，他无意中说出了真相。

definitions.explanation_en: A small, unintentional mistake or error, especially one that is minor or easily overlooked.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一个微小的、无意的错误或疏忽，通常不严重或容易被忽视。
definitions.example_en: It was just a slipping in his speech—he didn’t mean to offend anyone.
definitions.example_cn: 这只是他讲话中的一个小口误——他并非有意冒犯任何人。

comparison.analysis: “Sliding” (滑动) 更强调沿一个表面平稳、持续的横向移动，常用于物理运动（如滑梯、冰面滑行），带有一定控制性或方向性；而 “slipping” 更强调失去控制、意外或不稳定的滑动，常伴随危险或失误。
“Deteriorating” (恶化) 是一个更正式、更广泛的术语，用于描述任何系统、状态或条件的持续性衰退，涵盖健康、环境、关系等；而 “slipping” 在表示衰退时更口语化，常用于个人表现、标准或行为的轻微下滑，语气较轻。
“Leaking” (泄露) 通常指信息、液体或气体从容器或保密系统中意外逸出，强调物理或保密层面的“外泄”；而 “slipping” 在表示信息泄露时更侧重于言语或行为中的无意识失误，不一定是系统性漏洞。
